newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-SCHALKE GRAB LATE GOAL TO BEAT DORTMUND.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SCHALKE GRAB LATE GOAL TO BEAT DORTMUND.

text.p: Substitute Ingo Anderbruegge fired UEFA Cup champions Schalke to a 1-0 victory over European Cup winners Borussia Dortmund with a late goal in Saturday's Rhine Valley derby.
Midfielder Anderbruegge scored in the 86th minute, just eight minutes after coming off the bench, in a clash played in sweltering conditions in Gelsenkirchen.

Schalke, with two wins and one loss in their first three matches, climbed into third place in the early-season Bundesliga table behind Karlsruhe and Kaiserslautern. Borussia Dortmund are fifth behind Bayern Munich.

"That we beat the (European) Champions isn't as interesting to me as picking up three points with the win," said Schalke trainer Huub Stevens. "It was not possible to play attractive soccer in this weather."
Dortmund trainer Nevio Scale said his team, who have one win, one draw and one defeat after three matches, had played poorly.

"I am not at all satisfied with my team," Scala said. "They played poorly and Schalke deserved to win. We were unable to play fluidly after the match on Wednesday against Cologne. But we have to accept this defeat without making a drama out of it."
